greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of tilings of a k X n rectangle using V (2m+1)-ominoes (m >= 0) in standard orientation; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: The shapes of the tiles are:
The sequence of column k (or row k) satisfies a linear recurrence with constant coefficients of order 2^(k-1) for k>0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..23, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; local k, m, r;
elif min(l)>0 then (t-> b(n-t, map(h->h-t, l)))(min(l))
elif l[-1]=n then b(n, subsop(-1=[][], l))
else for k while l[k]>0 do od; r:= 0;
for m from 0 while k+m<=nops(l) and l[k+m]=0 and n>m do
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = Module[{k, m, r}, Which[n == 0 || l == {}, 1, Min[l] > 0, Function[t, b[n-t, l-t]][Min[l]], l[[-1]] == n, b[n, ReplacePart[ l, -1 -> Nothing]], True, For[k=1, l[[k]] > 0, k++]; r = 0; For[m=0, k+m <= Length[l] && l[[k+m]] == 0 && n>m, m++, r = r + b[n, Join[l[[1 ;; k-1]], Array[1&, m], {m+1}, l[[k+m+1 ;; Length[l]]]]]]; r]];
A[n_, k_] := b[Max[n, k], Array[0&, Min[n, k]]];
Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 18 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 12 2018
